CatDescriptText: Cutline of similar image by another photographer of same event published in Pittsburgh Post Gazette November 9, 1944, reads: "Mozelle Thompson, who lives at 5132 Schenley Avenue yesterday received two prizes, amounting to $210, for his pictures which won recognition in the contest conducted by the Women's National Institute for the United States Time Corporation. Edith Belfour Dunn, left, representing the institute, and Jean Thoburn, center, Peabody art teacher, here congratulate Mozelle after the prizes were awarded at a special assembly at Peabody. - Post-Gazette Photo."
TitMainTitle: Edith Belfour Dunn presenting prize to Mozelle Thompson for his artwork, with art teacher Jean Thoburn standing between them, in Peabody High School auditorium
